abstract.text: The invention relates to an active inking system (1) which is fixed to the paying module (25) of self-service equipment. Said system includes a modification in the upper cover (4) of the cassette (24), where three upper holes (5) and one front hole (6) are made; the upper holes (5) fix the spreader assembly (2) and the front hole (6) receives the male quick coupler (13) through which the ink (29) enters. The system (1) comprises a spark sensor (14), component fixing structure (12), male quick coupler (13), ink cylinders (15), screws (16), ink outlet connections (20), actuating trigger (17), CO2 gas cylinders (18), tubes (19) and connections (21) for compressed gas. The spreader assembly (2) comprises a tank (10) aligned with the front opening (6) of the top cover (4) of the cassette (24), the tank (10) in communication with the spreader tube (8) equipped with holes (9) directed to the notes (7) through which the ink (29) is ejected for marking them. The sparks (27) activate the spark sensor (14) that activates the trigger (17), breaks the seal (28) of the CO2 cylinder (18), pressurizes the tubes for compressed gas (19), moves the front (22) and rear (23) pistons and pushes the ink (29).

Se describe un sistema de entintado activo (1) fijado al módulo pagador (25) de los equipos de autoservicio. Dicho sistema incluye una modificación em la tapa superior (4) del casete (24), donde se hace tres orificios superiores (5) y un orificio frontal (6); los orificios superiores (5) fijan el conjunto esparcidor (2) y el orificio frontal (6) recibe el acoplador rápido macho (13) por donde entra la tinta (29). El sistema (1) comprende un sensor de chispa (14), estructura de fijación de componentes (12), acoplador rápido macho (13), cilindros de tinta (15), tornillos (16), conexiones de salida de tinta (20), gatillo de accionamiento (17), cilindros de gas CO2 (18), tubos (19) y conexiones (21) para gas comprimido. El conjunto esparcidor (2) comprende un tanque (10) alineado con el orificio frontal (6) de la tapa superior (4) del casete (24), el tanque (10) en comunicación con el tubo esparcidor (8) equipado con agujeros (9) dirigidos a los billetes (7) por donde se expulsa la tinta (29) para marcarlos. Las chispas (27) activan el sensor de chispa (14) que activa el gatillo (17), rompe el sello (28) del cilindro de CO2 (18), presuriza los tubos para gas comprimido (19), mueve los émbolos frontales (22) y trasero (23) y empuja la tinta (29).

abstract.text: The present disclosure provides shared circuitry configurations that may be implemented in a plasma generation system to improve control over application of electrical energy to a plasma generator, thereby providing improved performance. In some embodiments, shared circuitry configurations described herein may be implemented to improve performance of a traveling spark igniter that is configured to generate and propagate plasma using a Lorentz force and a thermal force, such as by applying electrical energy to electrodes of a plasma generator following breakdown between the electrodes. Other plasma generator configurations may also benefit from the circuitry configurations described herein.

La présente divulgation concerne des configurations de circuiterie partagée qui peuvent être mises en œuvre dans un système de génération de plasma pour améliorer la maîtrise de l'application d'énergie électrique à un générateur de plasma, ce qui permet d'obtenir des performances améliorées. Selon certains modes de réalisation, des configurations de circuiterie partagée décrites dans la description peuvent être mises en œuvre pour améliorer les performances d'un allumeur à étincelle mobile qui est configuré pour générer et propager un plasma à l'aide d'une force de Lorentz et d'une force thermique, par exemple par application d'énergie électrique à des électrodes d'un générateur de plasma à la suite d'un claquage entre les électrodes. D'autres configurations de générateur de plasma peuvent également bénéficier des configurations de circuiterie décrites dans la description.

abstract.text: An electrostatic discharge trap device for protecting a water-resistant microphone from electrostatic discharge may include a conductive material positioned between a microphone port and a microphone venting stack-up to prevent liquid entry into the microphone, wherein the electrostatic discharge trap device is configured to receive an electric spark from the microphone port and conduct the electric spark away from the microphone venting stack-up to a conductive layer.

invention_title.text: INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS

abstract.text: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

INTRAVASCULAR LITHOTRIPSY CATHETER WITH OMNI-DIRECTIONAL SHOCK WAVE EMITTERS

abstract.text: An exemplary catheter for generating shock waves includes a catheter body; an enclosure mounted to the catheter body; an emitter band positioned at least partially around the catheter body and within the enclosure; and at least three electrodes positioned adjacent to the emitter band and spaced apart from the emitter band by respective spark gaps, the at least three electrodes together with the emitter band forming electrode pairs of at least three shock wave emitters of the emitter band, wherein at least one of the at least three shock wave emitters can be driven separately from at least one other of the at least three shock wave emitters.

Un cathéter donné à titre d'exemple permettant de générer des ondes de choc comprend un corps de cathéter ; une enceinte montée sur le corps de cathéter ; une bande émettrice positionnée au moins partiellement autour du corps de cathéter et à l'intérieur de l'enceinte ; et au moins trois électrodes positionnées adjacentes à la bande émettrice et espacées de la bande émettrice par des éclateurs respectifs, lesdites au moins trois électrodes formant conjointement avec la bande émettrice des paires d'électrodes d'au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc de la bande émettrice, au moins l'un desdits au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc pouvant être commandé séparément d'au moins un autre desdits au moins trois émetteurs d'ondes de choc.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE COMMUNICATION ET APPAREIL DE COMMUNICATION
COMMUNICATION METHOD AND COMMUNICATION APPARATUS
通信方法和通信装置

abstract.text: The present application provides a communication method and a communication apparatus, applied to the field of communications. The technical solution of the present application can support IEEE protocols, such as IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT protocol, IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8 protocol, Integrated mmWave/integrated millimeter wave/IMMW protocol, IEEE 802.15/UWB protocol, IEEE 802.11bf/sensing protocol, or spark link/nearlink standard protocol. In the technical solution of the present application, sensing devices indicate relative position acquisition related information, thereby facilitating acquisition of the relative position between the sensing devices, improvement of the accuracy of a sensing result and the flexibility of sensing device deployment, and broadening of the range of application scenarios of sensing measurement.

La présente demande concerne un procédé de communication et un appareil de communication, appliqués au domaine des communications. La solution technique selon la présente demande peut prendre en charge des protocoles IEEE, tels que le protocole IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT, le protocole IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, le protocole mmWave intégrées/ondes millimétriques intégrées/IMMW, le protocole IEEE 802.15/UWB, le protocole IEEE 802.11bf/détection, ou le protocole standard Sparklink/Nearlink. Dans la solution technique de la présente demande, des dispositifs de détection indiquent des informations relatives à l'acquisition de position relative, ce qui facilite l'acquisition de la position relative entre les dispositifs de détection, améliore la précision d'un résultat de détection et la flexibilité du déploiement de dispositifs de détection, et élargit la plage de scénarios d'application de mesure de détection.

本申请提供了通信方法和通信装置，应用于通信领域。本申请的技术方案可以支持IEEE协议，如IEEE 802.11be/Wi-Fi 7/EHT协议，IEEE 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8协议，Integrated mmWave/集成毫米波/IMMW协议，IEEE 802.15/UWB协议，IEEE 802.11bf/sensing/感知协议，或星闪/spark link/nearlink标准协议。本申请的技术方案中，感知设备之间指示相对位置获取相关的信息，有助于获取感知设备之间的相对位置，从而有助于提高感知结果的准确性，提高感知设备部署的灵活性，以及提高感知测量的应用场景的广泛性。

abstract.text: This application relates to an ELR communication method, apparatus and readable storage medium. The method comprises: generating and sending an ELR PPDU. The ELR PPDU comprises a first field, which is generated based on an ELR identification sequence, and the ELR identification sequence is carried on 53 subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are -26 to 26. The elements of the ELR identification sequence on the subcarriers whose subcarrier indexes are {-24,-20,-16,-12,-8,-4,4,8,12,16,20,24} are all 0. This application can improve the accuracy of packet detection. This application supports IEEE protocols such as 802.11bn/UHR/Wi-Fi 8, integrated millimeter wave/IMMW, UWB, or Sensing. This application also supports the spark link/spark link/nearlink standard protocol, etc.

invention_title.text: Thermal runaway test system with ignition capability and thermal runaway test method for lithium battery wherein the system comprises a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device

abstract.text: This invention relates to a thermal runaway test system and thermal runaway test method for lithium batteries. The thermal runaway test system includes a machine body, a test chamber, a cover, a battery test trough, a thermal runaway triggering device, an igniter, and a control device. The test chamber is disposed in the machine body and has a chamber and an opening. The cover is movable between a closed position and an open position. The battery test trough is located in the chamber and is used for placing a lithium battery. The thermal runaway triggering device is controllable to apply at least one trigger to the lithium battery. An ignition end of the igniter extends into the chamber. The control device is electrically connected to the thermal runaway triggering device and the igniter. The control device controls the thermal runaway triggering device to generate the at least one trigger, and controls the ignition end of the igniter to generate a spark in the chamber.

invention_title.text: HYDROPHOBIC FILTER MEDIUM

abstract.text: A filter medium is provided that comprises a nonwoven layer. The nonwoven layer comprises a sizing agent and a hydrophobic, stiffening binder resin. The nonwoven layer may be corrugated. A method producing a filter medium is also provided. The filter medium may be a fuel filter, oil filter, air filter, or an electric discharge filter. The filter medium, after corrugation, pleating, or embossing, avoids or minimizes water ingress, while still allowing the filter medium to maintain its structural and filtration properties.

invention_title.text: SUBSTRATE TREATMENT APPARATUS AND SUBSTRATE TREATMENT METHOD

abstract.text: The present invention provides an apparatus for treating a substrate. The apparatus for treating a substrate may include: a process treatment unit that provides a treatment space in which the substrate is treated; and a plasma generation unit that is provided above the process treatment unit and generates plasma from a process gas. The plasma generation unit includes: a plasma chamber having an electric discharge space formed therein; a shield unit surrounding the exterior of the plasma chamber; an antenna which surrounds the shield unit from the outside of the shield unit and to which high-frequency power is applied; and a connecting unit electrically connecting the shield unit and the antenna.

abstract.text: A system for manufacturing a nanomaterial may include a first electrode; a second electrode spaced apart from the first electrode by a gap; and a chamber configured to enclose the first electrode, the second electrode, and a liquid. The system may also include a power supply configured to provide electrical energy to at least one of the first electrode and the second electrode; and a pump configured to cause the liquid to flow through the gap between the first electrode and the second electrode.

abstract.text: This control device for a wire electric discharge machine includes: a movement control unit that causes a wire electrode to move along a machining path; a voltage control unit that controls a machining power supply and applies a machining voltage across poles; and a machining control unit that maintains a non-discharge state in which discharge does not occur between the poles until the wire electrode reaches a first position on the machining path, that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position, gradually increases the discharge density so that the discharge density of the discharge becomes a set value set as a machining condition, and that, upon the wire electrode reaching the first position again, gradually decreases the discharge density to achieve a non-discharge state.

L'invention concerne un dispositif de commande pour une machine d'électroérosion par fil comprenant : une unité de commande de mouvement qui amène une électrode en fil à se déplacer le long d'un trajet d'usinage ; une unité de commande de tension qui commande une alimentation électrique d'usinage et applique une tension d'usinage entre des pôles ; et une unité de commande d'usinage qui maintient un état sans décharge dans lequel aucune décharge ne se produit entre les pôles jusqu'à ce que l'électrode en fil atteigne une première position sur le trajet d'usinage, qui, lorsque l'électrode en fil atteint la première position, augmente progressivement la densité de décharge de telle sorte que la densité de décharge de la décharge devient une valeur définie définie comme condition d'usinage, et qui, lorsque l'électrode en fil atteint à nouveau la première position, diminue progressivement la densité de décharge pour pour parvenir à l'état sans décharge.

ワイヤ放電加工機の制御装置は、ワイヤ電極を加工経路に沿って移動させる移動制御部と、加工電源を制御して極間に加工電圧を印加する電圧制御部と、ワイヤ電極が加工経路上の第１位置に到達するまでは極間において放電が発生しない無放電状態を維持し、ワイヤ電極が第１位置に到達すると、放電の放電密度が加工条件として設定された設定値になるように放電密度を徐々に増加させ、ワイヤ電極が第１位置に再び到達すると、放電密度を徐々に減少させて極間を無放電状態にさせる加工制御部と、を備える。

invention_title.text: Electric discharge machine for precision process
정밀 가공용 방전 가공기

abstract.text: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 정밀 가공용 방전 가공기에 관한 것으로서, 상측의 헤드부(100)와 하측의 거치부(200)로 구분하면서 헤드부(100)와 거치부(200) 사이가 개방된 형태로 형성된 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물(20)이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물(20)이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180) 및, 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a)를 구성하며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하며, 상기 양극전극부(180)는, 전극(170) 하단에 연결되는 수직형 제1몸체(181-1)와 상기 제1몸체(181-1)의 일측면 하단에서 수평으로 연결되면서 상면 중앙에서 하면 중앙으로 관통된 제1체결공(181-3)이 형성된 제2몸체(181-2)로 구성된 제1지지부(181)와, 상기 제1지지부(181)의 제2몸체(181-2) 하부에 배치되어 제1체결공(181-3)의 위치에 대응된 제2체결공(182-1)이 형성되면서 하면 중앙에 제1전극팁(183)의 상부를 결속하는 제1삽입공이 형성된 전극연결체(182)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

invention_title.text: Electric discharge machining system for precision setting and process
정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 방전 가공 시스템

abstract.text: 본 발명은 전극의 세팅시간을 줄이고 작업능률을 향상시킬 수 있는 정밀 세팅 및 가공을 포함하는 방전 가공 시스템에 관한 것으로서, 외관을 형성하는 본체부, 상기 본체부에 구비되며 피가공물이 거치되는 거치부(200), 상기 거치부(200)의 상면에 돌출 형성되어 상기 피가공물이 지지되며 전류가 흐르는 음극전극부, 상기 거치부(200)의 상면을 마주하도록 배치되며 전류가 흐르는 양극전극부(180), 상기 양극전극부(180)를 고정하면서 높이 및 좌우이동을 제어하는 지그이동부(100a) 및, 상기 피가공물의 방전가공을 제어하는 방전제어모듈을 포함하는 방전가공기가 구비되며, 상기 방전제어모듈은, 피가공물의 3D 도면을 이용하여 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공을 자동으로 수행하는 방전가공프로그램과, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공시 상기 방전가공기에 설치된 센서들의 측정값을 화면에 표시하고 동작 상태를 실시간으로 화면에 표시하는 모니터와, 상기 방전가공기의 동작을 제어하는 신호를 입력하는 동작스위치 입력부와, 상기 방전가공프로그램을 저장하고, 상기 피가공물의 방전 가공 측정값을 시간대별로 저장하는 메모리 및, 상기 동작스위치 입력부의 입력 신호와 상기 방전가공프로그램에 따라 방전 가공을 자동 수행을 제어하는 제어부로 구성되며, 상기 지그이동부(100a)는, 동력부(110)와 상기 동력부(110) 하측에 위치한 높이조절부(120)와 상기 높이조절부(120) 하측에 위치한 연결체(140)와 상기 연결체(140) 하측에 위치한 지그회전체(150)와 상기 지그회전체(150)의 하측에 위치한 전극지그(160)와 상기 전극지그(160) 하측에 위치한 소정의 수직길이로 형성된 전극(170)과 상기 전극(170)의 하측에 위치하여 피가공물의 가공부위에 접촉하는 제1전극팁(183)으로 구성된 양극전극부(180)를 포함하는 것을 특징으로 한다.

invention_title.text: Apartment house electric discharge panel
공동주택 전기 분전반

abstract.text: 이러한 본 발명은 전기 분전반의 소음과 진동이 벽면에서 공동주택으로 확산이 분전구에 의하여 줄여지도록 하는 것이다.

invention_title.text: ELECTROSTATIC CHUCK

abstract.text: An electrostatic chuck 10 includes a dielectric substrate 100, an internal electrode 140 provided inside the dielectric substrate 100, a base plate 200 in which a through hole 230 is formed, a power supply member 400 that is a member for supplying power to the internal electrode 140 and is inserted through the through hole 230, and an insulating member 500 arranged between an inner surface of the through hole 230 and the power supply member 400. The insulating member 500 includes a tubular first insulating member 510, and a tubular second insulating member 520 covering a part of the first insulating member 510 on an outer peripheral side. The electrostatic chuck 10 further includes an annular member 530 for preventing an electric discharge along a path from the power supply member 400 to the inner surface of the through hole 230 passing between the first insulating member 510 and the second insulating member 520.

abstract.text: This machining tank lifting device of an electric discharge machine lifts a machining tank (4) in which a machining liquid is stored. The machining tank lifting device of the electric discharge machine includes: a drive source (1) and a rack pinion (2) for lifting the machining tank (4) on the depth side of the machining tank (4); and a cylinder (5), having the function of preventing the front side of the machining tank (4) from dropping down in relation to the depth side, on the front side of the machining tank (4).

Ce dispositif de levage de réservoir d'usinage d'une machine à décharge électrique soulève un réservoir d'usinage (4) dans lequel un liquide d'usinage est stocké. Le dispositif de levage de réservoir d'usinage de la machine à décharge électrique comprend : une source d'entraînement (1) et un pignon de crémaillère (2) pour lever le réservoir d'usinage (4) sur le côté de la profondeur du réservoir d'usinage (4) ; et un cylindre (5), ayant pour fonction d'empêcher le côté avant du réservoir d'usinage (4) de tomber par rapport au côté de la profondeur, sur le côté avant du réservoir d'usinage (4).
放電加工機の加工槽昇降装置は、加工液を貯留された加工槽（４）を昇降する。放電加工機の加工槽昇降装置は、加工槽（４）の奥側に、加工槽（４）を昇降するための駆動源（１）およびラックピニオン（２）を配置し、加工槽（４）の正面側に、加工槽（４）の奥側に対する正面側の垂れ下がりを防ぐ機能を有するシリンダ（５）を配置する。

abstract.text: According to the invention, solid recovered fuel pellets are torrefied to charred pellets, producing torrefaction gas that is converted into a torrefaction syngas containing hydrogen and carbon monoxide. A syngas stream comprising the torrefaction syngas is supplied to a CO shift unit, where carbon monoxide reacts with water steam to carbon dioxide and hydrogen, generating shifted syngas. The invention provides that the shifted syngas is passed through a low temperature heat recovery unit, where its heat energy is transferred to at least two process water streams that are used as process water during the production of the product gas stream. By utilizing this heat, waste heat losses are reduced, and the overall energy efficiency of the process is improved. Further, an increased hydrogen content of the product gas is achieved.

abstract.text: Feedstock including an amphiphilic lignocellulosic biomass can be processed using enzymes prior to pulping. The enzymes break down the biomass by disrupting the surface or cell walls or by reducing wax or other components. Such enzymes include cellulases, hemicellulases, laccases, peroxidases, and pectinases. Suitable enzymes can be obtained from secretions of microbes in soil organic matter from soil in which the feedstock was grown. If the pulping process includes steam explosion, such enzy matic processing of a biomass prior to steam explosion will increase absorption of water by the processed feedstock. In steam explosion, due to the increased ability of the processed feedstock to absorb water, steam explosion is more effective in breaking apart the processed feedstock. For other pulping processes, such enzymatic treatments break down the biomass, enabling extraction of the desired components from the processed feedstock through subsequent processing using less energy and fewer chemicals.

Une charge d'alimentation comprenant une biomasse lignocellulosique amphiphile peut être traitée à l'aide d'enzymes avant un dépulpage. Les enzymes décomposent la biomasse en perturbant la surface ou les parois cellulaires ou en réduisant la cire ou d'autres composants. De telles enzymes comprennent des cellulases, des hémicellulases, des laccases, des peroxydases et des pectinases. Des enzymes appropriées peuvent être obtenues à partir de sécrétions microbiennes dans une matière organique du sol à partir du sol dans lequel la charge d'alimentation a été cultivée. Si le processus de dépulpage comprend une explosion à la vapeur, un tel traitement enzymatique d'une biomasse avant explosion à la vapeur augmentera l'absorption d'eau par la charge d'alimentation traitée. Dans l'explosion à la vapeur, en raison de la capacité accrue de la charge d'alimentation traitée à absorber l'eau, l'explosion à la vapeur est plus efficace pour briser la charge d'alimentation traitée. Pour d'autres processus de dépulpage, de tels traitements enzymatiques décomposent la biomasse, ce qui permet l'extraction des composants souhaités à partir de la charge d'alimentation traitée par traitement ultérieur en utilisant moins d'énergie et moins de produits chimiques.

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a smoke generator (10; 10a; 10b) comprising a housing (15) with a condensate inlet (11) for receiving a smoke condensate and a steam inlet (12) for receiving overheated water steam, wherein the smoke condensate is converted to smoke particles when the smoke condensate interacts with the overheated water steam, and the smoke particles are accessible at a smoke outlet (13). The invention also relates to a system for feeding smoke particles to a smoke cabinet (23).

"La présente invention concerne un générateur de fumée (10; 10a; 10b) comprenant un boîtier (15) doté d'une entrée de condensat (11) pour recevoir un condensat de fumée et d'une entrée de vapeur (12) pour recevoir de la vapeur d'eau surchauffée. Le condensat de fumée est transformé en particules de fumée lorsque le condensat de fumée interagit avec la vapeur d'eau surchauffée, et les particules de fumée sont accessibles au niveau d'une sortie de fumée (13). L'invention concerne également un système qui fournit des particules de fumée dans une armoire à fumée (23)."

invention_title.text: Stable supply system for hydrogen production by clean energy and control method thereof
一种清洁能源制氢的稳定供给系统及其控制方法

extracted_name.value: LILING TOP COLLECTION IND CO LTD
醴陵陶润实业发展有限公司

abstract.text: The invention relates to the technical field of hydrogen production, in particular to a stable supply system for hydrogen production through clean energy and a control method of the stable supply system. The gas mixing chamber is used for mixing methanol steam and desalted water steam to form mixed gas; the heat preservation chamber is arranged outside the gas mixing chamber and is used for preserving heat of the gas mixing chamber through hydrogen mixed gas output by the reaction chamber; the reaction hydrogen production unit is connected with the raw material mixing unit and is used for providing chemical reaction conditions of the mixed gas to generate hydrogen mixed gas of hydrogen and carbon dioxide; the gas separation unit is used for separating the hydrogen mixed gas to output pure hydrogen; the detection unit is used for detecting the internal air pressure of the gas mixing chamber, the air pressure of the gas inlet of the reaction chamber, the air pressure of the gas outlet of the reaction chamber and the vibration frequency of the gas mixing chamber; the hydrogen production stability is improved.

本发明涉及制氢技术领域，尤其涉及一种清洁能源制氢的稳定供给系统及其控制方法，稳定供给系统包括：原料混合单元，包括用以对甲醇蒸气和脱盐水蒸气进行混合以形成混合气体的气体混合室和设置在气体混合室外部其通过反应室输出的氢气混合气体对气体混合室进行保温的保温室；反应制氢单元，其与所述原料混合单元相连，用以提供所述混合气体的化学反应条件以生成氢气和二氧化碳的氢气混合气体；气体分离单元，用以将所述氢气混合气体进行分离以输出纯净氢气；检测单元，用以分别检测气体混合室的内部气压、反应室的进气口的气压、反应室的出气口的气压以及气体混合室的振动频率；本发明提高了制氢的稳定性。

invention_title.text: Steam-water separation device for cooking equipment and cooking equipment
用于烹饪设备的汽水分离装置及烹饪设备

extracted_name.value: 杭州老板电器股份有限公司

abstract.text: The utility model relates to the technical field of kitchen appliances, in particular to a steam-water separation device for cooking equipment and the cooking equipment, the steam-water separation device for the cooking equipment comprises a separator, the separator comprises a separation pipe and a separation plate, the separation plate is arranged in the separation pipe and divides the separation pipe into a steam inlet side and a steam outlet side, and the steam inlet side is communicated with the steam outlet side. Screen holes are formed in the separation plate, steam flows in from one end of the separation pipe, penetrates through the screen holes in the separation plate and flows out from the other end of the separation pipe, and the separation plate is used for water-steam separation. The steam passes through the separation plate through the sieve holes of the separation plate, and in the process, the separation plate can intercept water drops, so that the water drops can be intercepted more efficiently, water accumulation is reduced, the influence on food nutrition and taste is reduced, and the use effect of the cooking equipment is improved.

abstract.text: The invention discloses a selective condensation mechanism and wastewater treatment equipment and method with selective condensation, the selective condensation mechanism is a condensation plate, the condensation plate comprises a main body part and a selective condensation coating covering the main body part, the main body part is internally provided with a cooling cavity used for containing a refrigerant, and the selective condensation coating covers the main body part. The affinity of the selective condensation coating and impurities in waste water steam is greater than that of the main body part and the impurities in the waste water steam; or the selective condensation mechanism is a condensation pipeline, the condensation pipeline comprises an inner pipeline and an outer pipeline which are sleeved with each other, a cooling cavity used for containing a refrigerant is formed between the inner pipeline and the outer pipeline, and the selective condensation coating is arranged on the inner wall of the inner pipeline; the affinity of the selective condensation coating and impurities in waste water steam is greater than that of the condensation plate and the impurities in the waste water steam. The energy consumption in the condensation process can be reduced, and organic components in waste water can be separated and recycled easily.

abstract.text: The utility model discloses a flow control sauna machine, and belongs to the technical field of steam sauna machines. A flow control sauna machine comprises a switching box, a water inlet part is arranged at the front end of the switching box, and a bag body is arranged in the rear end of the switching box; a water outlet is formed in the water inlet part, and a connecting pipeline is arranged between the water outlet and the bag body, so that the water inlet part is communicated with the bag body; a flow blocking piece is arranged at the lower end of the water outlet, the flow blocking piece floats on the liquid level, close to the water outlet end, in the connecting pipeline under the normal condition, the density of the flow blocking piece is smaller than that of water, and the flow blocking piece does not have water absorption; the diameter of the flow blocking piece is larger than that of the water outlet. The diameter of the flow blocking piece is smaller than that of the connecting pipeline. Water-steam conversion can be effectively carried out by reducing the water drainage speed, and water backflow is prevented.

abstract.text: The water vapor separation box comprises a box body, one side of the box body is provided with a hot water inlet, the other side of the box body is provided with a water outlet nozzle, the water outlet nozzle is provided with a steam exhaust outlet and hot water outlets, the hot water outlets comprise the first hot water outlet and the second hot water outlet, and the steam exhaust outlet is communicated with the steam exhaust outlet. A stop block is arranged above the water outlet nozzle; the bottom wall of the inner cavity of the box body is inclined from the hot water inlet to the stop block to form an inclined surface; by designing the reasonable layout of the hot water inlet, the hot water outlet and the steam exhaust outlet and arranging the stop block and the inclined bottom wall in the box body, steam and water flow can be effectively separated in the flowing process of hot water. Steam is discharged through the steam discharging channel, hot water is discharged through the hot water channels with different heights according to the hydrodynamic law, efficient water vapor separation is achieved, and it is ensured that output hot water is more stable and purer.

abstract.text: The invention discloses a zero-power-consumption thermal power cold end system vacuum optimization device, which belongs to the technical field of vacuum optimization, and comprises a front vacuum absorber, an annular water-gas self-oscillation processing mechanism, a gas-gas-liquid self-separation device and a gas-liquid isolation secondary separation device which are sequentially connected in series, and the output end is connected with a condenser hot well through a gas-liquid isolation secondary separation device. The chemical replenishment water is dynamically mixed with the steam-steam mixture at the outlet of the condenser through jet entrainment, so that water steam is condensed, after the formed steam-steam mixture is separated, non-condensable gas is extracted by vacuumizing equipment, and liquid is recycled to a hot well. The device does not need extra energy consumption, the vacuum degree of the condenser is effectively improved through multi-stage mixing, separation and recovery closed loops, and coal consumption and operation cost are reduced.

本发明公开了一种零功耗火电冷端系统真空优化装置，属于真空优化技术领域，包括依次串联的前置真空吸收器、环形水气自激振荡处理机构、气汽液自分离装置和气液隔离二次分离装置，整体接入抽真空设备管道，输入端连凝汽器出口，输出端通过气液隔离二次分离装置连凝汽器热井。化补水经射流卷吸与凝汽器出口气汽混合物动态混合，使水蒸气冷凝，形成的气汽水混合物经分离后，不凝气体由抽真空设备抽除，液体回收至热井。装置无需额外能耗，通过多级混合、分离及回收闭环，有效提升凝汽器真空度，降低煤耗与运行成本。

invention_title.text: APPAREIL DE FABRICATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
APPARATUS FOR MANUFACTURING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조 장치

abstract.text: The present invention relates to an apparatus for manufacturing lithium sulfide. By using the apparatus according to the present invention, when manufacturing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, such that frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic efficiency of the process. In addition, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and a solvent, from which moisture has been removed, are reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility during mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting a forward reaction, thus enabling high-quality lithium sulfide to be produced with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted in units of ㎛ without a separate pulverization space or a separate pulverization step, thus providing excellent convenience and mass productivity.

La présente invention concerne un appareil de fabrication de sulfure de lithium. En utilisant l'appareil selon la présente invention, lors de la fabrication de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, de telle sorte qu'une réparation ou un remplacement fréquent en raison de la corrosion et de la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites n'est pas nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer l'efficacité économique du procédé. De plus, le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi et un solvant, à partir duquel l'humidité a été éliminée, sont réutilisés, ce qui permet de réduire les coûts de traitement et de sécuriser la faisabilité économique pendant la production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, ce qui permet d'empêcher une réaction inverse à l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser une réaction directe, ce qui permet de produire du sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé. De plus, la taille des particules peut être ajustée en unités de µm sans espace de pulvérisation séparé ou étape de pulvérisation séparée, ce qui permet d'obtenir une excellente commodité et une excellente productivité en masse.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조 장치에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따른 장치를 활용하면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRÉPARATION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PREPARING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for preparing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when lithium sulfide is prepared by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction proceeds under relatively mild conditions compared with conventional technologies. Thus, repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of reactors and various piping components is not frequently required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. In addition, the unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvent from which moisture has been removed can be reused, thereby reducing process costs and securing economic feasibility in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed, thereby preventing the reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promoting the forward reaction to prepare high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de préparation de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lorsque du sulfure de lithium est préparé par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction se déroule dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport aux technologies classiques. Ainsi, la réparation ou le remplacement dû à la corrosion et à la défaillance de réacteurs et de divers composants de tuyauterie n'est pas fréquemment nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer la faisabilité économique du procédé. De plus, le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi et le solvant dont l'humidité a été éliminée peuvent être réutilisés, ce qui permet de réduire les coûts de traitement et de garantir une faisabilité économique dans la production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, ce qui permet d'empêcher la réaction inverse à l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser la réaction directe pour préparer du sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PRODUCING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for producing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when producing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium source and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions compared to the prior art, and thus the economic efficiency of the process is improved since frequent repairs or replacements necessitated by corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping are not required. In addition, since dehydrated, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvents are recycled, the process cost is reduced, and thus economic efficiency can be achieved in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed to prevent a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promote a forward reaction, thereby enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield. In addition, particle size can be adjusted at a µm level without a separate pulverization space or pulverization step, and thus excellent convenience and mass productivity are achieved.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de production de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lors de la production de sulfure de lithium par réaction entre une source de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, ce qui améliore l'efficience économique du procédé, car il n'est pas nécessaire de procéder à des réparations ou des remplacements fréquents résultant de la corrosion et la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites. De plus, comme le sulfure d'hydrogène et les solvants déshydratés n'ayant pas réagi sont recyclés, le coût du procédé est réduit, ce qui permet d'atteindre une bonne efficience économique dans la production de masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées afin d'empêcher une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et de favoriser une réaction directe, permettant ainsi la production d'un sulfure de lithium de haute qualité, d'une grande pureté et d'un rendement élevé. De plus, la granulométrie peut être ajustée à l'échelle du µm sans espace ni étape de pulvérisation séparés, ce qui garantit d'excellents avantages et une bonne productivité de masse.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

According to the present invention, when preparing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium raw material and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is carried out under relatively mild conditions as compared to the prior art, and thus frequent repair or replacement due to corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping is not required, thereby improving the economic feasibility of the process. Selon la présente invention, lors de la préparation de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une matière première de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement modérées par rapport à l'état de la technique, et ainsi une réparation ou un remplacement fréquent en raison de la corrosion et de la défaillance d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites n'est pas nécessaire, ce qui permet d'améliorer la faisabilité économique du processus. De plus, en réutilisant le sulfure d'hydrogène n'ayant pas réagi, dont l'humidité a été éliminée, et un solvant, les coûts de traitement sont réduits, ce qui permet d'assurer la faisabilité économique pour la production de masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont efficacement éliminées, empêchant ainsi une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et favorisant une réaction directe, permettant ainsi la production de sulfure de lithium de haute qualité avec une pureté élevée et un rendement élevé. De plus, un ajustement de taille de particule peut être obtenu en unités de µm sans espace de pulvérisation ni étape de pulvérisation séparés, ce qui favorise la production de masse et la praticité.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다. 또한, 별도의 분쇄 공간 내지 분쇄 단계 없이 ㎛ 단위로 입자 사이즈 조절이 가능하여 편의성과 양산성이 우수하다.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ DE PRODUCTION DE SULFURE DE LITHIUM
METHOD FOR PRODUCING LITHIUM SULFIDE
황화리튬 제조방법

abstract.text: The present invention relates to a method for producing lithium sulfide. According to the present invention, when producing lithium sulfide by a reaction between a lithium source and hydrogen sulfide, the reaction is performed under relatively mild conditions compared to the prior art, and thus the economic efficiency of the process is improved since frequent repairs or replacements necessitated by corrosion and failure of a reactor and various piping are not required. In addition, since dehydrated, unreacted hydrogen sulfide and solvents are recycled, the process cost is reduced, and thus economic efficiency can be achieved in mass production. Furthermore, moisture and water vapor generated by the lithium sulfide production reaction are effectively removed to prevent a reverse reaction to lithium hydroxide and promote a forward reaction, thereby enabling the production of high-quality lithium sulfide with high purity and high yield.

La présente invention concerne un procédé de production de sulfure de lithium. Selon la présente invention, lors de la production de sulfure de lithium par une réaction entre une source de lithium et du sulfure d'hydrogène, la réaction est effectuée dans des conditions relativement douces par rapport à l'état de la technique, et ainsi l'efficacité économique du procédé est améliorée étant donné que des réparations ou des remplacements fréquents à cause de la corrosion et des défaillances d'un réacteur et de diverses conduites ne sont pas nécessaires. En outre, étant donné que le sulfure d'hydrogène et les solvants déshydratés n'ayant pas réagi sont recyclés, le coût du procédé est réduit, ce qui permet d'obtenir une efficacité économique lors d'une production en masse. En outre, l'humidité et la vapeur d'eau générées par la réaction de production de sulfure de lithium sont éliminées de manière efficace pour empêcher une réaction inverse vers l'hydroxyde de lithium et favoriser une réaction directe, ce qui permet la production d'un sulfure de lithium de haute qualité présentant une pureté élevée et avec un rendement élevé.

본 발명은 황화리튬 제조방법에 관한 것으로, 본 발명에 따르면, 리튬 원료와 황화수소 간 반응으로 황화리튬을 제조할 때, 종래 기술 대비 상대적으로 온화한 조건 하에서 반응이 수행되므로 반응기 및 각종 파이핑(piping)의 부식과 고장에 따른 잦은 수리 내지 교체가 요구되지 아니하여 공정의 경제성이 향상된다. 또한, 수분이 제거된 미반응 황화수소와 용매가 재사용됨으로써, 공정 비용이 절감되어 대량 생산 시 경제성을 확보할 수 있다. 나아가 황화리튬 생성 반응으로 발생한 수분과 수증기가 효과적으로 제거되어, 수산화리튬으로의 역반응을 방지하고, 정반응을 촉진하여 고순도, 고수율로 고품질의 황화리튬을 제조할 수 있다.

invention_title.text: SYSTÈME DE PRODUCTION D'HYDROGÈNE
HYDROGEN PRODUCTION SYSTEM
水素製造システム

abstract.text: Provided is a hydrogen production system (40) which comprises: an exhaust heat reception unit (41) that receives exhaust heat generated by an external exhaust heat source (11); a water vapor generation unit (42) that generates water vapor by heating water by means of the exhaust heat received by the exhaust heat reception unit (41); a cell stack (43) that electrolyzes the water vapor generated by the water vapor generation unit (42) so as to generate hydrogen; and a replenishment unit (44) that, when the amount of exhaust heat is insufficient with respect to the amount necessary for generating the required amount of water vapor, replenishes water, water vapor, or the water vapor generation unit (42) with heat, or replenishes the cell stack (43) with water vapor from an external water vapor supply source (95).

L'invention concerne un système de production d'hydrogène (40) qui comprend : une unité de réception de chaleur d'échappement (41) qui reçoit la chaleur d'échappement générée par une source de chaleur d'échappement externe (11) ; une unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) qui génère de la vapeur d'eau en chauffant de l'eau au moyen de la chaleur d'échappement reçue par l'unité de réception de chaleur d'échappement (41) ; un empilement de cellules (43) qui électrolyse la vapeur d'eau générée par l'unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) de façon à générer de l'hydrogène ; et une unité de réapprovisionnement (44) qui, lorsque la quantité de chaleur d'échappement est insuffisante par rapport à la quantité nécessaire pour générer la quantité requise de vapeur d'eau, réapprovisionne de l'eau, de la vapeur d'eau ou l'unité de génération de vapeur d'eau (42) en chaleur, ou réapprovisionne l'empilement de cellules (43) en vapeur d'eau provenant d'une source d'alimentation en vapeur d'eau externe (95).

外部排熱源（１１）から発生した排熱を受取る排熱受取り部（４１）と、排熱受取り部（４１）が受取った排熱によって水を加熱することにより水蒸気を生成する水蒸気生成部（４２）と、水蒸気生成部（４２）が生成した水蒸気を電気分解して水素を生成するセルスタック（４３）と、排熱の量が、要求される量の水蒸気を生成するために必要な量に対して不足した場合に、水、水蒸気、若しくは水蒸気生成部（４２）に熱を補充するか、または、外部の水蒸気供給源（９５）からセルスタック（４３）に水蒸気を補充する補充部（４４）と、を備える水素製造システム（４０）。

invention_title.text: APPAREIL DE PRODUCTION DE BIOCHARBON POREUX À HAUTE PERFORMANCE
APPARATUS FOR MANUFACTURING HIGH-PERFORMANCE POROUS BIOCHAR
다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치

abstract.text: Disclosed is an apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar, capable of preventing water vapor and gas in a carbonization facility from leaking to the outside, and preventing a coking phenomenon in which livestock manure remaining in a carbonization furnace adheres to the inner circumferential surface of the carbonization furnace. The apparatus for manufacturing a high-performance porous biochar comprises: a livestock manure supply facility for supplying and transferring a large amount of livestock manure containing moisture; and a carbonization facility for, when the livestock manure is input from the livestock manure supply facility, creating an oxygen-blocked atmosphere within the carbonization facility and heating the carbonization facility to a predetermined temperature to carbonize the livestock manure, wherein the livestock manure supply facility is configured to automatically open and close an outlet according to whether the livestock manure is discharged, and seal a connection portion between the livestock manure supply facility and the carbonization facility.

L'invention concerne un appareil de production d'un biocharbon poreux à haute performance, apte à empêcher la fuite vers l'extérieur de la vapeur d'eau et du gaz dans une installation de carbonisation, et à empêcher un phénomène de cokéfaction par lequel le fumier restant dans un four de carbonisation adhère à la surface circonférentielle interne du four de carbonisation. L'appareil de fabrication d'un biocharbon poreux à haute performance comprend : une installation d'alimentation en fumier destinée à fournir et transférer une grande quantité de fumier contenant de l'humidité ; et une installation de carbonisation destinée à, lorsque le fumier est introduit à partir de l'installation d'alimentation en fumier, créer une atmosphère appauvrie en oxygène à l'intérieur de l'installation de carbonisation et chauffer l'installation de carbonisation à une température prédéterminée afin de carboniser le fumier, l'installation d'alimentation en fumier étant conçue pour ouvrir et fermer automatiquement une sortie selon que le fumier est évacué ou non, et sceller une partie de raccordement entre l'installation d'alimentation en fumier et l'installation de carbonisation.

탄화 설비 내의 수증기 및 가스가 외부로 누출되는 것을 방지하고, 탄화로 내에 잔류된 축분이 탄화로의 내주면에 부착되는 코킹현상을 방지할 수 있는 다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치를 개시한다. 다공성 고기능 바이오차 제조장치는 수분을 포함하는 대량의 축분을 공급 및 이송하는 축분 공급 설비 및 축분 공급 설비로부터 축분이 투입되면 내부를 산소가 차단된 분위기로 조성한 후 일정온도로 가열하여 축분을 탄화시키는 탄화 설비를 포함하고, 축분 공급 설비는 축분의 배출 여부에 따라 자동으로 출구를 개폐하고, 축분 공급 설비와 탄화 설비의 연결부위를 기밀하도록 구성된다.

invention_title.text: SPECTROSCOPIE DE POLARISATION À EFFET STARK ET PROCÉDÉS
STARK EFFECT POLARIZATION SPECTROSCOPY AND METHODS

abstract.text: A method of and system for monitoring the level of hydrogen peroxide gas in a system such as an isolation barrier. Gas is sampled from the system to a gas cell. The sampled gas may include hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor. A laser beam from a laser source at a known polarization state is passed through the gas cell and the hydrogen peroxide gas and water vapor therein. An electrical field is created in the gas cell to reduce optical interference from water vapor while preserving the ability to more accurately measure the concentration of hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell. A change in the polarization state of the laser beam after passage through the gas cell is detected. Based on the detected change in the polarization state of the laser beam, the concentration of the hydrogen peroxide gas in the gas cell is determined.

L'invention concerne un procédé et un système de surveillance du niveau de peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans un système tel qu'une barrière d'isolation. Le gaz est fourni en échantillon du système à une cellule à gaz. L'échantillon de gaz peut comprendre du peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux et de la vapeur d'eau. Un faisceau laser provenant d'une source laser à un état de polarisation connu est amené à passer à travers la cellule à gaz et le peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux et la vapeur d'eau à l'intérieur de celle-ci. Un champ électrique est créé dans la cellule à gaz pour réduire l'interférence optique provenant de la vapeur d'eau tout en préservant la capacité de mesurer plus précisément la concentration en peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans la cellule à gaz. Un changement dans l'état de polarisation du faisceau laser après le passage à travers la cellule à gaz est détecté. Sur la base du changement détecté dans l'état de polarisation du faisceau laser, la concentration en peroxyde d'hydrogène gazeux dans la cellule à gaz est déterminée.

invention_title.text: PROCÉDÉ ET SYSTÈME DE PRODUCTION DE VAPEUR D'EAU SURCHAUFFÉE À PARTIR DE PEROXYDE D'HYDROGÈNE DE FAIBLE CONCENTRATION
METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR THE PRODUCTION OF SUPERHEATED WATER VAPOR FROM LOW CONCENTRATION HYDROGEN PEROXIDE
MÉTODO Y SISTEMA DE PRODUCCIÓN DE VAPOR DE AGUA SOBRECALENTADO A PARTIR DE PERÓXIDO DE HIDRÓGENO DE BAJA CONCENTRACIÓN

abstract.text: The present invention relates to improvements provided by a system and process for releasing energy and performing work with said energy release applicable in a reaction product capture arrangement; more specifically, within the field of chemical energy release in an afterburner and high-flow steam arrangement utilizing at least one reconcentrated fluid to increase efficiency in harnessing the released energy.

La présente invention concerne les améliorations apportées par un système et un procédé pour libérer de l'énergie et effectuer un travail avec une autre libération d'énergie applicable dans un système de capture de produits de réaction; plus particulièrement, dans le domaine de la libération d'énergie chimique dans un système de postcombustion et vapeur à flux élevé à l'aide d'au moins un fluide reconcentré pour augmenter l'efficacité en termes d'exploitation de l'énergie libérée.

La presente invención se refiere a las mejoras provistas por un sistema y proceso para liberar energía y realizar trabajo con dicha liberación de energía aplicable en un arreglo de captación de productos de reacción; más específicamente, dentro del campo de liberación de energía química en un arreglo de postcombustión y vapor de alto flujo utilizando al menos un fluido reconcentrado para incrementar la eficiencia en el aprovechamiento de la energía liberada.

invention_title.text: STRUCTURE ORGANOMÉTALLIQUE
METAL ORGANIC FRAMEWORK
金属有機構造体

extracted_name.value: NATIONAL UNIV CORPORATION TOKAI NATIONAL HIGHER EDUCATION AND RESEARCH SYSTEM [JP]
日本特殊陶業株式会社,
国立大学法人東海国立大学機構

abstract.text: This metal organic framework comprises a first ligand that has a benzene ring and has two or more functional groups for coordination, and a second ligand that does not contain a benzene ring and contains one functional group for coordination. The ratio of the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of the metal organic framework at a relative pressure of 0.95 to the water vapor adsorption level per unit mass of a basic structure MOF at a relative pressure of 0.95 is 84% or greater in a water vapor isotherm measured at 298K when a metal organic framework having only the first ligand as a ligand is identified as the basic structure MOF on the basis of the results of powder XRD analysis of the metal organic framework.

La présente invention concerne une structure organométallique comprenant un premier ligand qui a un cycle benzène et a deux groupes fonctionnels ou plus pour la coordination, et un second ligand qui ne contient pas de cycle benzène et contient un groupe fonctionnel pour la coordination. Le rapport du niveau d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par unité de masse de la structure organométallique à une pression relative de 0,95 au niveau d'adsorption de vapeur d'eau par unité de masse d'une structure de base MOF à une pression relative de 0,95 est de 84% ou plus dans une isotherme de vapeur d'eau mesurée à 298K lorsqu'une structure organométallique ayant uniquement le premier ligand en tant que ligand est identifiée comme structure de base MOF sur la base des résultats de l'analyse XRD sur poudre de la structure organométallique.

金属有機構造体は、ベンゼン環を有すると共に、配位のための官能基を２つ以上有する第１の配位子と、ベンゼン環を含まず、配位のための官能基を１つ含む第２の配位子と、を備える。金属有機構造体を粉末ＸＲＤ分析した結果に基づいて、配位子として、第１の配位子のみを有する金属有機構造体を基本構造ＭＯＦとして特定したときに、２９８Ｋで測定した水蒸気吸着等温線において、基本構造ＭＯＦについての相対圧力が０．９５のときの単位質量当たりの水蒸気吸着量に対する、金属有機構造体についての相対圧力が０．９５のときの単位質量当たりの水蒸気吸着量の比率が、８４％以上である。

一种超低温液氢存储舱

abstract.text: An ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen storage cabin is provided with a cylindrical inner cabin, the inner cabin is supported and fixed in an outer cabin through a filling layer, the inner cabin and the outer cabin form a filling layer space, and the filling layer space is filled with low-temperature LNG or low-temperature liquid nitrogen. The inner cabin is composed of an inner cabin outer wall and an inner cabin inner wall, the inner cabin outer wall and the inner cabin inner wall form a vacuum layer, and the vacuum layer is filled with perlite and vacuumized. A double-layer compartment is arranged, an insulating layer is laid on an outer compartment, an inner compartment is of a vacuum double-wall heat insulation structure, and the space between the inner compartment and the outer compartment is filled with LNG or liquid nitrogen with the temperature close to that of liquid hydrogen. According to the scheme, the ultralow-temperature liquid state maintenance of-163 DEG C LNG or-196 DEG C liquid ammonia medium is easily realized through a mature reliquefaction system, so that the liquid state maintenance of the ultralow-temperature-253 DEG C liquid hydrogen medium is indirectly ensured, the heat transfer between the liquid hydrogen cabin and the external environment can be greatly reduced, and the technical difficulty and the technical cost of ultralow-temperature storage of the liquid hydrogen are reduced.

一种超低温液氢存储舱，有圆筒形内舱，内舱通过填注层支撑固定在外舱内部，内舱与外舱形成填注层空间，填注层空间内填充有低温LNG或低温液氮。内舱由内舱外壁和内舱内壁组成，内舱外壁与内舱内壁形成真空层，真空层内填注珍珠岩并抽真空。本发明采用双层隔舱设置，外舱敷设绝缘层，内舱采用真空双壁绝热结构，内外舱之间充装与液氢温度较为接近的LNG或液氮，考虑到直接对液氢实现液体状态维持技术难度高、耗能大，本方案通过成熟的再液化系统轻松实现对‑163℃LNG或‑196℃液氨介质的超低温液体状态维护，从而间接保证超低温‑253℃液氢介质的液体状态维持，可大大降低液氢舱与外部环境之间的热量传递，降低液氢超低温存储技术难度和技术成本。

abstract.text: The invention discloses a liquid hydrogen medium active exhaust cooling test system and method. The system comprises a vacuum module, a liquid hydrogen storage box module, a gas replacement and filling module, an exhaust cooling test module, a helium pressurization module, a leakage and safe discharge module, an external heat flow simulation module and a measurement and control module. According to the scheme, on the basis of simulating the external vacuum environment, the test of active exhaust cooling of the liquid hydrogen medium space is achieved through gas replacement, filling, testing and the like, and compared with the prior art, the liquid hydrogen medium space active exhaust cooling device is comprehensive in function.
本发明公开了一种液氢介质主动排气降温试验系统和方法，该系统包括：真空模块、液氢贮箱模块、气体置换和加注模块、排气降温测试模块、氦气增压模块、泄出与安全排放模块、外热流模拟模块和测量与控制模块。通过本发明所述方案，在模拟外部真空环境的基础上，通过气体置换、加注、测试试验等，实现对液氢介质空间主动排气降温的测试，与现有技术相比，本发明功能全面。

invention_title.text: Emergency cut-off stop valve for liquid hydrogen
一种液氢用紧急切断截止阀

extracted_name.value: 苏州纽威阀门股份有限公司

abstract.text: The utility model provides an emergency cut-off stop valve for liquid hydrogen, which comprises a valve body, a valve clack, a fixer and a sealing ring, and the valve clack is arranged in the valve body; the valve clack is suitable for abutting against the side wall of a runner opening in the valve body. The fixer is connected with the bottom of the valve clack; the sealing ring is arranged between the valve clack and the fixator and is configured to protrude out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, and the part, protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, of the sealing ring is suitable for abutting against the side wall of a runner opening in the valve body and sealing the runner opening; the side wall depth of a flow channel opening in the valve body is larger than the width of the sealing ring protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack. The depth of the side wall of the flow channel opening in the valve body is larger than the width of the part, protruding out of the circumferential side of the valve clack, of the sealing ring, after the sealing ring loses efficacy due to excessive abrasion, effective sealing can still be formed through tight attaching between the valve clack and the side wall of the flow channel opening in the valve body, and liquid hydrogen medium leakage is prevented.

本实用新型提供一种液氢用紧急切断截止阀，包括阀体、阀瓣、固定器以及密封环，阀瓣设于阀体内部；阀瓣适于与阀体内部流道口侧壁抵接；固定器与阀瓣底部连接；密封环设置在阀瓣与固定器之间，密封环被配置为凸出阀瓣周侧，密封环凸出阀瓣周侧部分适于与阀体内部流道口侧壁抵接并封闭流道口；其中，阀体内部流道口侧壁深度大于密封环凸出阀瓣周侧部分宽度。通过设置阀体内部流道口侧壁深度大于密封环凸出阀瓣周侧部分宽度，在密封环由于磨损过多失效后，仍可以通过阀瓣与阀体内部流道口侧壁之间贴紧形成有效密封，防止液氢介质泄漏。

invention_title.text: Methane hydrogen regeneration olefin recovery system
一种甲烷氢再生回收烯烃系统

extracted_name.value: SHAANXI YANCHANG CHINACOAL YULIN ENERGY CHEMICAL CO LTD
陕西延长中煤榆林能源化工股份有限公司

abstract.text: The system is characterized in that the input end of a methane hydrogen heater is communicated with a demethanizer, and the output end of the methane hydrogen heater is communicated with the input end of a liquid phase dryer; the output end of the mixed C4 heater is communicated between the output end of the methane hydrogen heater and the input end of the liquid phase dryer; the output end of the gas-liquid separation tank is communicated with the input end of the regenerated methane hydrogen coalescer; and the output end of the regenerated methane hydrogen coalescer is communicated with the input end of an external fuel pipe network. According to the utility model, a mixed C4 steam stripping process and a regenerated methane hydrogen secondary dehydration process are added, so that the water content in regenerated methane hydrogen gas is ensured to meet the requirements of receiving conditions of a fuel gas pipe network. According to the system for regenerating and recycling olefin by using methane hydrogen, disclosed by the invention, a mixed C4 and methane hydrogen medium is self-produced, so that the purpose of regenerating and recycling ethylene-propylene olefin substances by using the liquid-phase dryer is achieved, the nitrogen consumption and the torch gas emission are reduced, and the ethylene-propylene yield and the resource utilization rate are improved.

本申请公开了一种甲烷氢再生回收烯烃系统，甲烷氢加热器的输入端与脱甲烷塔连通，且其输出端与所液相干燥器的输入端连通；混合碳四加热器的输出端连通于甲烷氢加热器的输出端与液相干燥器的输入端之间；气液分离罐的输出端与再生甲烷氢聚结器的输入端连通；再生甲烷氢聚结器的输出端与外部燃料管网的输入端连通。本实用新型中增加混合碳四汽提流程和再生甲烷氢二级脱水流程，保证再生甲烷氢气体中的水含量达到燃料气管网接收条件要求。利用本申请中的甲烷氢再生回收烯烃系统自产混合碳四和甲烷氢介质，实现液相干燥器再生和回收乙烯丙烯烃类物质的目的，降低氮气用量和火炬气体排放，提升乙烯丙烯收率和资源利用率。

abstract.text: The invention relates to the technical field of graphene preparation, and provides a graphene preparation system and method.The system comprises a gas supply device, a plasma synthesis device, a gas-solid separation device, a product collection device, a tail gas separation device and a hydrogen storage device. The invention relates to a graphene preparation method, which comprises the following steps: ionizing a medium gas to generate plasma, and introducing a reaction gas to carry out a synthesis reaction; separating the reacted gas from a reaction product; settling and collecting the obtained reaction product; separating the obtained gas into hydrogen, medium gas and reaction gas; the medium gas and the reaction gas are recycled after being compressed, and the separated hydrogen is purified and stored. According to the technical scheme, the production cost is reduced, the material handling capacity is large, the productivity is high, the method is suitable for industrial application, energy consumption is low, pollution is avoided, expandability is high, and the application range is wide.

本发明涉及石墨烯制备技术领域，本发明提供一种石墨烯制备系统及方法，所述系统包括：供气装置、等离子体合成装置、气固分离装置、产物收集装置、尾气分离装置、储氢装置。一种石墨烯制备方法，包括以下步骤：使介质气体电离产生等离子体，再将通入反应气体进行合成反应；将反应后的气体和反应产物进行分离；将获得的反应产物进行沉降、收集；将获得的气体进行分离，分离为氢气、介质气体、反应气体；介质气体、反应气体分别经过压缩后循环使用，分离出的氢气进行提纯并储存。本发明的技术方案，降低了生产的成本，物料处理量大，产能高，适用于产业化应用，低能耗、无污染，可扩展性强，适用范围广。

invention_title.text: Normal-pressure storage tank for storing liquid hydrogen
一种用于液氢储存的常压储罐

extracted_name.value: CHONGQING NAIDE ENERGY EQUIPMENT CO LTD
重庆耐德能源装备股份有限公司

abstract.text: The utility model provides a normal-pressure storage tank for storing liquid hydrogen. The normal-pressure storage tank comprises an inner tank made of metal and used for containing a low-temperature liquid hydrogen medium, an outer tank located outside the inner tank and made of metal, a heat insulation interlayer located in an interlayer between the inner tank and the outer tank and playing a heat insulation role, and a cold shield arranged in the heat insulation interlayer. The cold shield comprises a cold shield coil pipe which is made of a metal material and is coiled in the heat insulation interlayer, the inlet end of the cold shield coil pipe is connected with a boil-off gas outlet of the gas phase space at the top of the inner tank, and the outlet end of the cold shield coil pipe penetrates through the outer tank, extends out of the outer tank and is connected with a boil-off gas recovery device. The cold shield medium entering the cold shield is liquid hydrogen evaporated gas in the inner tank, the defect of high daily evaporation rate of a liquid hydrogen low-temperature normal-pressure storage technology can be overcome without introducing an external cold source, and the operation cost of the normal-pressure storage tank is reduced.

本实用新型提出了一种用于液氢储存的常压储罐，包括由金属制成的用于盛装低温液氢介质的内罐、位于内罐外的由金属制成的外罐、位于内罐和外罐之间的夹层中的起绝热作用的绝热夹层、以及设在绝热夹层中的冷屏；冷屏包括采用金属材料制成的盘绕在绝热夹层中的冷屏盘管，冷屏盘管的入口端与内罐顶部气相空间的蒸发气出气口相连，冷屏盘管的出口端穿过外罐延伸至外罐外与蒸发气回收装置相连。本实用新型进入冷屏的冷屏介质为内罐内的液氢蒸发气，无需引入外部冷源，即可解决液氢低温常压储存技术日蒸发率高的缺点，降低该常压储罐的运行成本。

abstract.text: The invention belongs to the technical field of plate and strip production and equipment, and particularly relates to a structure and method for improving air tightness of a rapid cooling section of a continuous annealing furnace in a high-hydrogen mode, the structure comprises a sealing roller chamber shell, a roller and sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks, the bottom of the roller is in sealing connection with a graphite sealing gasket, and the bottom and the two ends of the graphite sealing gasket are fixed through castable; back lining plates are arranged between the two ends of the castable and the sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks, the positions between the back lining plates and the sealing roller chamber shell lining refractory bricks are filled with micropore heat insulation plates, and gaps of the upper end, the side wall and the bottom in the sealing roller chamber are filled with ceramic fibers. The invention mainly aims to ensure the stability of the sealing roller chamber structure of the rapid cooling section, improve the sealing performance in the roller chamber, prevent excessive hydrogen medium from overflowing to the slow cooling section and the overaging section, save the consumption of hydrogen energy and ensure the safety of a unit.

本发明属于板带生产及装备技术领域，尤其涉及一种连退炉快冷段高氢模式下提高气密性的结构及方法，包括密封辊室外壳、辊子、密封辊室外壳内衬耐火砖，所述辊子底部与石墨密封垫密封连接，石墨密封垫的底部及两端通过浇注料固定，所述浇注料的两端与密封辊室外壳内衬耐火砖之间设置有背衬板，所述背衬板与密封辊室外壳内衬耐火砖之间填充微孔绝热板，密封辊室内上端、侧壁及底部各部位的缝隙通过陶瓷纤维进行填充。本发明的主要目的是保证快冷段密封辊室结构的稳定性，并且提高辊室内的密封性，防止过量的氢气介质溢流至缓冷段和过时效段，节省氢气能源的消耗，保证机组的安全性。

invention_title.text: Medium filtering method and device based on hydrogen purity instrument
一种基于氢纯度仪上的介质过滤方法及装置

extracted_name.value: HUANENG YIMIN COAL & ELECTRICITY CO LTD
华能伊敏煤电有限责任公司

abstract.text: The invention discloses a medium filtering method and device based on a hydrogen purity instrument. The method comprises the following steps: connecting a sampling pipe to a source of a medium to be measured so as to conveniently introduce the medium; the other end of the sampling pipe is connected with the filtering device, so that the medium passes through the sampling pipe before entering the filtering device; the filtered oil mist is adsorbed and sampled through a filter element in the filtering device, and the oil mist is separated from the hydrogen medium; oil gathered in the filtering device is introduced into the oil storage tank through the drainage pipe; a pressure sensing module and an automatic oil drain valve are installed at the bottom of the oil storage tank. According to the medium filtering method and device based on the hydrogen purity instrument, on one hand, the measurement accuracy of hydrogen purity parameters is improved, a reliable basis is provided for operators to monitor and maintain the purity of hydrogen, and the operation economy and safety of a generator are guaranteed; on the other hand, the automatic oil discharging valve is adopted to achieve the automatic sewage discharging function, the daily maintenance workload is reduced, and the automation level of equipment is improved.

本发明公开了一种基于氢纯度仪上的介质过滤方法及装置，包括通过将采样管连接到待测量介质的源头方便引入介质；再将采样管的另一端与过滤装置相连，从而确保介质在进入过滤装置前经过采样管；通过过滤装置中的滤芯吸附和采样过滤中的油雾，将油雾与氢气介质分离；通过引流管将集聚在过滤装置中的油引入储油罐；在储油罐底部安装感压模块和自动排油阀。该基于氢纯度仪上的介质过滤方法及装置，一方面提高了氢纯度参数测量准确性，为运行人员监视和保持氢气的纯度提供可靠依据，保证了发电机运行经济性和安全性；另一方面采用自动排油阀实现自动排污功能，减少了日常维护工作量，提高了设备的自动化水平。

abstract.text: A storage cabin capable of storing ultralow-temperature liquid hydrogen is provided with a cylindrical inner cabin, the inner cabin is supported and fixed in an outer cabin through a filling layer, the inner cabin and the outer cabin form a filling layer space, and the filling layer space is filled with low-temperature LNG or low-temperature liquid nitrogen. The inner cabin is composed of an inner cabin outer wall and an inner cabin inner wall, the inner cabin outer wall and the inner cabin inner wall form a vacuum layer, and the vacuum layer is filled with perlite and vacuumized. A double-layer compartment is arranged, an insulating layer is laid on an outer compartment, an inner compartment is of a vacuum double-wall heat insulation structure, and the space between the inner compartment and the outer compartment is filled with LNG or liquid nitrogen with the temperature close to that of liquid hydrogen. According to the scheme, the ultralow-temperature liquid state maintenance of-163 DEG C LNG or-196 DEG C liquid ammonia medium is easily realized through a mature reliquefaction system, so that the liquid state maintenance of the ultralow-temperature-253 DEG C liquid hydrogen medium is indirectly ensured, the heat transfer between the liquid hydrogen cabin and the external environment can be greatly reduced, and the technical difficulty and the technical cost of ultralow-temperature storage of the liquid hydrogen are reduced.

一种可以存储超低温液氢的存储舱，有圆筒形内舱，内舱通过填注层支撑固定在外舱内部，内舱与外舱形成填注层空间，填注层空间内填充有低温LNG或低温液氮。内舱由内舱外壁和内舱内壁组成，内舱外壁与内舱内壁形成真空层，真空层内填注珍珠岩并抽真空。本发明采用双层隔舱设置，外舱敷设绝缘层，内舱采用真空双壁绝热结构，内外舱之间充装与液氢温度较为接近的LNG或液氮，考虑到直接对液氢实现液体状态维持技术难度高、耗能大，本方案通过成熟的再液化系统轻松实现对‑163℃LNG或‑196℃液氨介质的超低温液体状态维护，从而间接保证超低温‑253℃液氢介质的液体状态维持，可大大降低液氢舱与外部环境之间的热量传递，降低液氢超低温存储技术难度和技术成本。

abstract.text: The invention discloses a high-temperature solid hydrogen storage and SOEC coupling hydrogen production and storage integrated system and method. The system comprises a water supply device, and the end of the water supply device is connected with a suction device; one end of the recovery device is connected with the suction device, and the other end is connected with a reaction device; the SOEC electrolytic reactor is connected with the reaction device, the SOEC electrolytic reactor comprises an anode end and a cathode end, and the anode end is connected with the recovery device; one end of the air delivery device is mounted between the reaction device and the SOEC electrolytic reactor, and the other end of the air delivery device is connected with a hydrogen high-temperature heat recovery device; the first end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with the hydrogen high-temperature heat recovery device, the second end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with the reaction device, the third end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with a condenser, the fourth end of the hydrogen medium-temperature heat recoverer is connected with a dryer, and the condenser is connected with the dryer. Medium-temperature and high-temperature heat energy released in the hydrogen storage process of the high-temperature metal hydride is recycled through the heat recycling device and used for producing high-temperature superheated steam needed by SOEC electrolysis, and the good heat and mass synergistic effect is achieved on the whole.

本发明公开了一种高温固态储氢与SOEC耦合制储氢一体化系统及方法，包括供水装置，其端部连接有抽吸装置；回收装置，一端与抽吸装置连接，另一端连接有反应装置；SOEC电解堆，与反应装置连接，SOEC电解堆包括阳极端和阴极端，阳极端与回收装置连接；风量输送装置，一端安装于反应装置与SOEC电解堆之间，另一端连接有氢气高温热回收装置；氢气中温热回收器，氢气中温热回收器的第一端与氢气高温热回收装置连接，第二端与反应装置连接，第三端连接有冷凝器，第四端连接有干燥器，冷凝器与干燥器连接。通过热量回收装置回收高温金属氢化物储氢过程中释放的中、高温热能，用于生产SOEC电解所需的高温过热蒸汽，整体实现了很好的热质协同效果。

abstract.text: FIELD: oil and gas production. ^ SUBSTANCE: invention refers to a method of preparing and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock involving heating of stock and hydrogen, preparation of end-products; herewith liquid (oil, black oil, oil refining and petrochemistry remains) charge stock is heated up to the temperature above 20-50C and exposed to thermal and/or thermomechanical (non-catalytic) cracking, molecular hydrogen and/or hydrogen enriched light hydrogenous mediums (natural or accompanying gas, gas and light fractions of oil refining and petrochemistry), if required are heated up separately from charge stock, supplied at greater pressure than that of the heating stage, to the stage of producing active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals to a reactor or reactor package with a catalyst heated to the required temperature, thereafter produced active hydrogen and/or light radicals are supplied to a stock heating and cracking zone for the reaction; the reaction products are supplied to the separation stage; a portion of gas and light fractions and also unreacted hydrogen and/or light hydrogenous initial mediums after the separation stage are supplied to the start of the process and introduced into the charge stock, light end fractions of reaction after the separation stage mainly with end boiling point to 350-360C, partially or completely supplied on the stage of producing light end commodity products (condensed gas, petrol, kerosene, diesel fuel) and/or partially returned and introduced into charge stock, heavy remains after the separation stage mainly with start boiling point 360C and above, are partially or completely supplied for producing heavy commodity products (bitumen, coke), and, probably, partially or completely supplied for reprocessing by the given method to the start of the process together with charge stock; the stock and/or separation remain cracking and heating stages, hydrogen and/or hydrogenous medium and catalyst heating, production of active atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and separation into light portion and heavy remains are combined in one device, and the ratio of the surface of the reactor or reactors with the catalyst to volume of the stock heating and/or cracking shall be increased so that maximally increase the interaction (reaction) area of atomic hydrogen and/or light radicals and heated or cracked hydrocarbon stock for effective utilisation of reacting products. The invention also concerns a unit for preparation and fine processing of hydrocarbon stock. ^ EFFECT: higher yield of light end products. ^ 19 cl, 3 tbl, 15 dwg

Изобретение относится к нефтеперерабатывающей, нефтехимической и химической промышленности. Изобретение касается способа подготовки и глубокой переработки углеводородного сырья, включающего нагрев сырья и водорода, получение конечных продуктов, при этом жидкое (нефть, мазут, остатки нефтепереработки и нефтехимии) исходное сырье нагревают до температуры выше 20-50°С и подвергают термическому и/или термомеханическому (некаталитическому) крекингу, молекулярный водород и/или легкие водородсодержащие среды, обогащенные водородом (природный или попутный газ, газ и легкие фракции нефтепереработки и нефтехимии), при необходимости подогревают отдельно от сырья, направляют при большем давлении, чем давление на стадии нагрева и крекинга, на стадию получения активного атомарного водорода и/или легких радикалов в реактор или пакет реакторов с нагретым до необходимой температуры катализатором, после которого полученные активный водород и/или легкие радикалы направляют в зону нагрева и крекинга сырья для проведения реакции, продукты реакции направляют на стадию разделения, часть газовых и легких фракций, а также непрореагировавшего водорода и/или легких водородосодержащих исходных сред после стадии разделения направляют в начало процесса и вводят в исходное сырье, легкие целевые фракции реакции после стадии разделения, преимущественно с температурой конца кипения до 350-360°С, частично или полностью направляют на стадию получения легких целевых товарных продуктов (сжиженный газ, бензин, керосин, дизельное топливо) и/или частично возвращают и вводят в исходное сырье, тяжелый остаток после стадии разделения, преим�

invention_title.text: COMPOSITION AND METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING ETTRINGITE COATED FIBER AND AGGLOMERATE
에트린자이트 코팅된 섬유 및 응집체 제조를 위한 조성물과방법

abstract.text: PURPOSE: A fiber is provided to sediment an ettringite crystalline on the surface of the fiber or the other disposition in a hydrogenous medium. CONSTITUTION: An ettringite coated agglomerate is manufactured by: generating an ettringite in a hydrogenous slurry while being near a fiber, an agglomerate, or other filling material for forming a mineralized complex material including an ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, or other filling material; and the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material reacting in the existence of water for forming the ettringite by adding a reactive material such as a calcium oxide and a sulfuric aluminium being sedimented to the surface of the treated fiber or the other disposition. Therefore, the ettringite treated fiber, agglomerate, and other filling material are added to a hydrogenous hardening material for improving a chemical and a mechanical combinations between the fiber and other dispositions in a concrete material.

섬유, 응집체 및 기타 충진재의 표면상에 에트린자이트 (3CaO·AlO·3Ca(SO)·30-32HO)를 침전시키기 위한 방법 및 조성물이 발표된다. 에트린자이트는 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재 근처에서 수성현탁액내에 생성되어 에트린자이트로 코팅된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재를 포함하는 광물화된 복합재료를 형성한다. 에트린자이트 처리된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재는 물의 존재하에서 반응하여 에트린자이트를 형성하며 이후에 처리되는 섬유 또는 기타 기질 표면상에 침전하는 칼슘산화물 및 황산알루미늄과 같은 반응물을 첨가함으로써 형성된다. 에트린자이트 처리된 섬유, 응집체 또는 기타 충진재는 수경화성 재료에 첨가되어서 결과의 경화된 수경화성 복합재료, 특히 시멘트 또는 콘크리트재료내에 섬유 또는 기타 기질간의 화학적 및 기계적 결합을 향상시킬 수 있다.

abstract.text: The plate (10) has a main surface for a fuel cell stack, where the surface is surrounded by outer edges (14) of the plate. A cathode input and a cathode output are provided at a cathode side, and an anode input and an anode output are provided at an anode side. A hydrogenous medium is fed to the anode side and a medium containing oxygen is fed to the cathode side. An outer edge of the stack is freely accessible, where the plate is coated at its outer edges by a sealant (15) and the sealant forms a frame (16) around the plate. A polymer material is provided as the sealant.

Die Erfindung betrifft eine Bipolarplatte mit von einer Außenkante (14) umgebenen Hauptfläche für einen Brennstoffzellenstapel aus einer Mehrzahl von jeweils durch die Bipolarplatten getrennten Brennstoffzellen mit einer Kathodenseite mit einem Kathodeneingang und einem Kathodenausgang sowie einer Anodenseite mit einem Anodeneingang und einem Anodenausgang, wobei der Anodenseite ein wasserstoffhaltiges Medium und der Kathodenseite ein sauerstoffhaltiges Medium zuführbar ist und wobei Außenkanten des Brennstoffzellenstapels frei zugänglich sind. DOLLAR A Es wird vorgeschlagen, dass die Bipolarplatte (10) an ihrer Außenkante (14) rahmenartig von einem Dichtmittel (15) umhüllt ist. DOLLAR A Die Erfindung betrifft ferner eine Brennstoffzelle mit einer solchen Bipolarplatte (10).
